goals.description: Preliminary exercises serve as preparation for further slackline training

tips.description: Best experience with barefoot or socks
Bend your knees slightly. This will bring you into a better initial position for movement compensation
Set a focus point in front of you
Hands over shoulder and bent in about 135 degree to the side
Slow but controlled execution
Straight upper body to hold you in the right position

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and balance with the left one

tips.description: Looping video on the right shows the correct execution
Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left leg to the side and stretch it
Straight upper body
Both arms should be loose
Focus on a point in front of you
Looping video on the right shows the correct execution
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right leg to the side and stretch it
Straight upper body
Both arms should be loose
Focus on a point in front of you

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot, other in the air and arms stretched out

tips.description: Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left leg to the side and stretch it
Straight upper body
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Focus on a point in front of you
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right leg to the side and stretch it
Straight upper body
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Focus on a point in front of you

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot. Bent your other leg and stabilize it sideways with the sole into your knee. Stretch your arms out.

tips.description: Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left foot upwards and bent it
Left foot stabilized sideways on your right knee
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Straight but relaxed upper body
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right foot upwards and bent it
Right foot stabilized sideways on your left knee
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Straight but relaxed upper body

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and raise your other leg to the front. Lean forward with your upper body and fixate the left leg with both arms

tips.description: Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left leg upwards
Lean your body towards the left leg
Stretch your arms out to the front
Fixate left knee with your hands
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right leg upwards
Lean your body towards the right leg
Stretch your arms out to the front
Fixate right knee with your hands

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and raise your other leg to the side. Lean sideward with your upper body and fixate the left leg with both arms

tips.description: Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left leg sideways
Lean your body towards the left leg
Stretch your arms out to the side
Fixate left knee with your hands
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right leg sideways
Lean your body towards the right leg
Stretch your arms out to the side
Fixate right knee with your hands

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot. Other foot up and stretch it behind your body. Arms are stretched out. Now bend your standing leg, go down until you feel confident and go up.

tips.description: Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left leg upwards
Move left leg to the back of your body
Do a squat by bending your knee
Hold position for a short time
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right leg upwards
Move right leg to the back of your body
Do a squat by bending your knee
Hold position for a short time

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot. Other foot up and stretch it in front of your body. Arms are stretched out. Now bend your standing leg, go down until you feel confident and go up.

tips.description: Right leg servers as standing leg
Raise the left leg upwards
Move left leg to the front of your body
Do a squat by bending your knee
Hold position for a short time
Left leg servers as standing leg
Raise the right leg upwards
Move right leg to the front of your body
Do a squat by bending your knee
Hold position for a short time

goals.description: Get a feeling for the line, become familiar with it and feel the imbalance of your body
You should be able to get on line and hold yourself for a short time at the end

tips.description: Starting at the sweet-spot (ca. 1/4 of the line) is easier
Foot is always in alignment with the slackline
Turn your palms to the top and your hands will raise automatically
Head is up and set a focus point
Counterbalance with your arms, upper and lower body
Sit down along with the line
Right leg bent on the ground
Left leg stretched forward and raised
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Leaning backward could make it more comfortable
Upper body doesn’t have be straight
Sit down along with the line
Left leg bent on the ground
Right leg stretched forward and raised
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Leaning backward could make it more comfortable
Upper body doesn’t have be straight
Sit down along with the line
Right leg stretched on the ground
Left leg stretched forward and raised
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Leaning backward could make it more comfortable
Upper body doesn’t have be straight
Sit down along with the line
Left leg stretched on the ground
Right leg stretched forward and raised
Both arms over shoulder and bent
Leaning backward could make it more comfortable
Upper body doesn’t have be straight
Stay left from the slackline
Place the right foot on the line
Right foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Left foot stretched to side for balancing
Bend knees slightly
Stay right from the slackline
Place the left foot on the line
Left foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Right foot stretched to side for balancing
Bend knees slightly
Stay right from the slackline
Place the right foot across the left on the line
Right foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Left foot stretched to side for balancing
Bend knees slightly
Stay left from the slackline
Place the left foot across the right on the line
Left foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Right foot stretched to side for balancing
Bend knees slightly

goals.description: You will execute static exercises and first approaches for walking
You learn the basics for staying and the preparation to walk on the line
You should be able to stay a couple of seconds on the line and feel more confident on it

tips.description: Could take more attempts to accomplish exercises
Keep in mind: focus point, sweet-spot, foot in line, knees slightly bent, straight upper body
Slow and controlled performance
Non standing foot serves also as balance support
Troubles with staying on the line? Keep the balancing leg in line with the standing leg when going up, then raise it to the side
The pressure is mostly around the ball of your foot
Stay left from the slackline
Place the right foot on the line
Right foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Balance with your arms and left leg
Stay right from the slackline
Place the left foot on the line
Left foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Balance with your arms and right leg
Stay right from the slackline
Place the right foot across the left on the line
Right foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Balance with your arms and left leg
Stay left from the slackline
Place the left foot across the right on the line
Left foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Balance with your arms and right leg
Stay left from the slackline
Place the right foot on the line
Right foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Place your left foot in front of your right
Stay as long as you can

checks.description: Left foot in front of right?

tips.description: Stay right from the slackline
Place the left foot on the line
Left foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Place your right foot in front of your left
Stay as long as you can

checks.description: Right foot in front of left?

tips.description: Stay right from the slackline
Place the right foot across the left on the line
Right foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Place your left foot in front of your right
Stay as long as you can

checks.description: Left foot in front of right?

tips.description: Stay left from the slackline
Place the left foot across the right on the line
Left foot is parallel with the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up with a little momentum and try to stay
Place your right foot in front of your left
Stay as long as you can

checks.description: Right foot in front of left?

tips.description: Stay left from the slackline
Place the right foot on the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up and try to stay
Do a squat by bending the right knee
Hold the lower position for a while
Stay right from the slackline
Place the left foot on the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get up and try to stay
Do a squat by bending the left knee
Hold the lower position for a while

goals.description: You are now able to stay confidently on the line with one foot and both feet
You will learn how to make your first steps
The goal is to be able to switch your standing leg and walk a few steps on the slackline

tips.description: When making a step you can guide your non standing foot to the side of the line and shift it forward
Let your knees together, so your legs can support each other
Make small steps → center of gravity doesn't have to be shifted that much forward
Use the whole body to counterbalance
Remember: stay calm, execute exercises slowly and controlled
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Set a focus point
Get on the line with your right foot
Place your left foot in front of your right
Shift your body to the front
Release the right foot from the line and balance
Hold this position for a while
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Set a focus point
Get on the line with your left foot
Place your right foot in front of your left
Shift your body to the front
Release the left foot from the line and balance
Hold this position for a while
Stay on the right side from the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get on the line with your right foot
Place your left foot in front of your right
Shift your body to the front
Release the right foot from the line and balance
Hold this position for a while
Stay on the left side from the line
Raise your hands above your shoulder
Get on the line with your left foot
Place your right foot in front of your left
Shift your body to the front
Release the left foot from the line and balance
Hold this position for a while
Get on the line with your right foot
Place your left foot in front of your right
Shift your body to the front and release the right foot
Place your right foot in front of your left
Shift your body to the front and release the left foot
Hold this position for a while
Get on the line with your left foot
Place your right foot in front of your left
Shift your body to the front and release the left foot
Place your left foot in front of your right
Shift your body to the front and release the right foot
Hold this position for a while
